meanings.definition: To eject or discharge in a sudden and forceful stream.
meanings.sent1: The water was splurting out of the broken pipe.
meanings.sent2: The soda can splurted when I opened it too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The fountain was splurting water like a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The volcano was splurting lava into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The fire hydrant was splurting water in all directions.

meanings.definition: To spend money extravagantly or wastefully.
meanings.sent1: She was splurting on designer clothes at the mall.
meanings.sent2: He splurted his entire paycheck on a fancy dinner.
meanings.sent3: The princess was splurting gold coins like confetti.
meanings.sent4: Money was splurting out of his pockets like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The millionaire was splurting cash at the charity auction.
